name: Mount Webster

trails_config.name: Webster Cliffs Trail
trails_config.description: Part of the Appalachian Trail. Ascends the massive, sheer cliffs on the eastern wall of Crawford Notch. Offers legendary views of the Willey Range and the notch floor.
trails_config.parking_info: Webster Cliff Trailhead, US-302, Hart's Location, NH

current_conditions.ai_summary: Experience the beauty of New Hampshire on Mount Webster. At 3911 feet, this summit commands impressive views of the surrounding wilderness.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 3911 feet, Mount Webster is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Webster Cliffs Trail**, a **6.6 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **local peak challenge**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Mount Jackson**, which is just 0.7 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
